image_analysis.description: A scan of a two-page spread from a book. The left page contains printed text from the book itself. The right page displays a scanned image of a letter on official letterhead from the Town of Palm Beach Police Department.
image_analysis.layout: Two-page spread. The left page has a header, body text, and a page number at the bottom. The right page is a formal letter with a letterhead, recipient address, body, and closing.

text_extraction.full_text:
JAMES PATTERSON

Under “[Do] you wanna lose your virginity”: “I already lost it.”
One of the victims has been caught with drugs and arrested.
She’s also been caught stealing from Victoria’s Secret. From the
state attorney’s perspective, these girls look like compromised
women. And if what they say about Epstein is true, wouldn’t that
make them prostitutes?

As witnesses, they would be weak, while the lawyers on
Epstein’s side were exceptionally strong.

Alan Dershowitz had represented Claus von Bülow, the Brit-
ish socialite who was acquitted of the murder of his wife, Sunny.
Dershowitz had been on O. J. Simpson’s team when the former
football star was acquitted of the murders of his ex-wife, Nicole
Brown Simpson and Nicole’s friend Ronald Lyle Goldman. And
rich as von Bülow and Simpson had been, neither one had had
the resources that Epstein was willing and able to deploy in his
own defense.

Neither of them had been intimate friends with his lawyer.

As far as Reiter was concerned, none of that mattered. Even if
Epstein thought that the girls he’d molested were eighteen years
old—even if they had lied to him—it didn’t matter under Flor-
ida law. The chief grew worried that in Epstein’s case exceptions
were being made, and he grew even more concerned with each
unreturned call that he made to the state attorney’s office.

On May 1, the Palm Beach PD asked the state attorney’s office
to issue an arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein.

That same day, Chief Reiter took the extraordinary step of
writing Barry Krischer a letter all but demanding that he recuse
himself from the case.

170

TOWN OF
POLICE D[EPARTMENT]
A NATIONAL AND STATE ACC[REDITED AGENCY]

PERSONAL AND CONFIDENTIAL

Mr. Barry E. Krischer, State Attorney
Office of the State Attorney
Fifteenth Judicial Circuit
401 North Dixie Highway
West Palm Beach, FL 33401

Dear Mr. Krischer,

Please find enclosed the probable cause [affidavit]
resulting from the Palm Beach Police Depa[rtment's investigation]. The submissio[n was made by Detectives]
Kellen and Haley Robson. [This follows]
Assistant State Attorney Lanna Belohlavek['s review of the Palm]
Beach Police Department's presentation fo[r prosecution].

I know that you agree that it is our shared
public interest by discharging our duties wi[thout fear or favor]. [It is with]
prior observation to you that I continue to fin[d your office's handling of this matter]
unusual. It is regrettable that I am forced [to make these observations, but my]
recent telephone calls to you and those of [your staff]
have been unanswered and messages ren[dered no response].

After giving this much thought and consider[ation, I have concluded that the]
course that your office's handling of this [case has taken provides]
sufficient reason exists to require your dis[qualification from these]
cases.

Sir[cerely],

[Signature]

Mi[chael S. Reiter]
Ch[ief of Police]

MSR/mt

345 South County Road • Palm Beach, Florida 33480-4443 • (

HOUSE_OVERSIGHT_010511

document_metadata.sender: Michael S. Reiter, Chief of Police, Town of Palm Beach Police Department

document_metadata.subject: Concerns regarding the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation and a request for recusal.

notes: The image is a composite of a page from a book (left) and a letter (right). The book text provides context for the letter. The letter on the right is partially obscured or cut off along the right margin, requiring interpretation for the missing text. The date of the letter is inferred from the text on the left page. The sender's full name and title are partially obscured but inferred from context and common knowledge of the case.
